Fields.DialogueText: Orion, our orders are in!
I'm here, Captain! What's the word?
It's a hunt - right up our alley. Take a look.
Don't mind if I do.
Hmm... this sounds serious. A Morgana attacking port towns...
She's cannibalizing ships like every other Morgana, but she's also going after civilian settlements with no apparent strategic value.
With firebombs. That is cruel, even by Morgana standards.
Oh, but we might need to clear out the Morganas that just popped onto the horizon first. Tally ho!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I assume you don't have a problem with making this our new priority?
Yeah. And it'll backfire on them, no pun intended.
You okay?

Fields.DialogueText: This is why I like you, Captain. You just get me.
If you mean it makes the enemy more likely to burn if we strike first, I like the way you think.
I was actually thinking more in terms of hardening our side's resolve. But your way works too.
I'm always okay, Captain. More than usually ready for bloodshed, though.
Right. So, where do we begin? I have some ideas, but...
So, have you had any ideas about your secret admirer?
Some of the men I've got my eye on are having a darts tournament after supper. You should join us, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Won't they be nervous with their captain hanging around?
As their superior, I'm not sure I should be hanging around below decks.
Count me in!

Fields.DialogueText: I'd hate for you to be left out. If you're worried, perhaps dress down a bit?
Pssh! Loosen up a bit! They won't bite... unless you want them to.
That's the spirit!
*ALARM*
Bloody Morganas. If we have to delay the tournament for this...
Better now than later.
@BATTLE
Ooh, a one! Unlucky!
A pity this isn't jeu de grenouille. I bet these English bulldogs wouldn't find this competition so easy.
I'm not doing much better tonight.
You look fine to me, mademoiselle. Heh heh.
Well, by that standard, so do you!
Orion, you're up!
So she's down here often?
Oui, all the time. She can take whatever they throw at her and give it right back.
It brings out some of the bolder women on the ship too. Makes the company very lively sometimes!
*APPLAUSE*
Hah, bullseye! Your turn, Captain!
Are you sure it's not you?
I'm sure. I don't mean to be dismissive, but I think our Romeo... actually, no. Never mind.
Unacceptable. You can't just leave me hanging, Captain. What not-dismissive thing were you going to say?

Fields.MenuText: Just that I think our mysterious friend is in the market for a gorgeous, supernatural muse, not a lover.

Fields.DialogueText: Luckily, I can be both!

Fields.MenuText: I think someone's playing games with you. Nothing I haven't said before.

Fields.DialogueText: Games are fine. I like games.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I like talking to you too much to resort to anonymous letters.

Fields.DialogueText: ... I don't know what to do with that.
Fair enough. So what's your plan? How are you going to track down your secret Cyrano?
Captain, I have an idea! Though I might technically need your permission to put it into action.
Oh?
See, in the letters, the writer speaks so eloquently of the hunt. So I've been contemplating what might lure my admirer into the open.
What if I offered him a chase? A series of contests designed to test his mettle. Open to all comers, comely or otherwise!
With what prize?
A date with me, of course.
A... date?
*WOOF, WOOF!*
We're about to be attacked?
I'm afraid so. Sound the horns!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You're more than welcome to participate, of course. If you're interested.

Fields.MenuText: Do you want me to be interested?
Orion, the captain competing with the crew for the affections of the ship isn't a good look.
But I'd win, and then you'd never find out who your secret admirer is.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you want me to want you to be interested?
It would look pretty good to me. I might even introduce oiled wrestling events.
Ha!
Oh, damn it. Things were just getting interesting.
*WHIMPER*
That sounds like Cappy. Did Orion forget to feed him again?
Now, now - no bacon unless you ask nicely. Siiiiit...
*WHIMPER*
There you go. Good doggy!
I see Cappy's figured out how to beg treats from the crew.
A-ah! Afternoon, C-captain. You startled me.
What's your name, sailor?
Harley Abney, Captain. Called up by the National Service.
It's - it's okay for me to play with him, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: It's fine. Cappy seems to like you.
It's fine, but don't spoil him with treats.
I think you'd have to ask Orion.

Fields.DialogueText: I like him too. You're a good little puppy, aren't you?
All right. Hear that, boy? Go easy on the bacon.
O-oh. Okay. I'll try to remember that.
*WOOF, WOOF! GRR...*
Ack! Did I do something wrong?
No, I think he senses Morganas nearby.
Captain! There's been a distress call. I'm prepared to change course.
Go for it.
And there he goes. National Service... a conscript. That's got to be rough.
@BATTLE
Captain! Here's the report from my aerial scout.
One augmented Morgana destroyer and several escorts. The escorts are ravaging the merchant and fishing boats in the port while the destroyer is bombarding the dock with incendiaries.
We're close but not close enough, dammit. How far out are they?
I estimate eight minutes to visual contact. Rrr...
*EIGHT MINUTES LATER*
*GRR... WOOF!*
Visual confirmed. Crew is at action stations and standing by.
Someone looks singed.
I should have guessed it would be Fire. In any case, she's mine!
Dammit, she's vanishing into the mist!
The regular destroyers aren't. They're turning toward us!
@BATTLE
Rrr. She's gone to ground without so much as a challenge.

Fields.MenuText: She can't hide from you forever.
She knows we're on her scent. She might be more cautious now.
Cruelty like that doesn't stay hidden for long.

Fields.DialogueText: Darn right. If she's going to play games with me, she'll rue the day I catch her even more.
Hmph. That's not good enough. I mean to take her out of the fight.
I fear you're right. And when she does resurface...
I've got her marked now. Just you wait.
You're in a better mood.
Oh, I'm still sore about losing Fire's trail. I'm just distracting myself with something more pleasant.
I've figured out how I want to do the contests. One of strength, one of skill, and one of speed. All the hunter's greatest assets.
Boxing, for strength. I know the men here like that. A footrace for speed. And I'm still working out the skill part.

Fields.MenuText: So you're really going through with this, huh?
Just keep the skill part clean.
Sounds fun, but will it really help you find your admirer?

Fields.DialogueText: You're just sad that you can't join the fun.
Hehe.
I hope so! It will give me leads, if nothing else.
I think we'll have the boxing tournament first. I just need to make sign-up sheets, figure out a bracket...
It would be interesting if we could have it be bare knuck--
No.
Hmph. So much for ancient tradition.
It's against regulations. Sorry.
Ah. That raises an interesting question. Are regulations why *you're* not writing me love letters?
*ALARM*
Erre es korakas!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: No. Actually, regulations are why I'm not plying you with wine and song.
Let's find out who your current letter-writer is before you start looking for replacements.
Maybe I'm waiting for you to write adoringly to me. Maybe a sonnet or two.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Well, what if we proposed some new regulations?
You almost sound worried.
Well, if anyone hurt you, I'd break their knees, and that wouldn't be good for my career. So I'm really hoping for the best here.
Me? Poetry?
Okay, Captain. Help me out. What rhymes with "night of debauched--"
Why, Captain, you...
Time to blow up some Morganas?
Oh, yes.
*ALARM*
Almost in range, Captain!
I see 'em.
@BATTLE
Okay, we're good. Pass along the order to stand down.
Good! For once we get Morganas out of the way before the big event.
You're cutting it close for time.
You're in for a show, though. Just wait, this place will go wild in a few minutes.
*SOME TIME LATER*
*APPLAUSE*
You're really enjoying yourself with that camera.
Mmm, yes. If any of them turn out to be my quarry, it will be nice to have good pictures.
Sun, sweat, salt air and muscle. It's a fine spectacle.

Fields.MenuText: To each their own, I guess.
It does seem like you've spent a lot of time filming me, though.
Heh. I'm happy you're happy.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. Whoever wins the matches, I win.
Maybe you've just been cunning about getting between me and the pretty boys.
You know, I'd be happier if you just...
Oh, the next match is about to start. I think I'd like some close-up shots...
*DING*
Enjoying the match, sailor?
Huh? Oh. Er, sure... maybe. Not entirely my thing.
Hmm.
You're just grumpy because you don't have time to flirt with me.
Yeah, that must be it.
Until our last encounter, Fire's tracks were moving up the coast in fairly regular order. But the newest attack, here, breaks the pattern.
That's the trouble with an enemy that can appear out of thin air. Command is at a loss.
Okay, spare me the lecture. Let me tell you what I think.
The Morganas may act chaotically, but they are not completely random. Their reach isn't unlimited.
My guess is that, now that she's reappeared, she will start a new pattern moving along this coast.
But which direction?
That's the problem. We'll need other hunters to stake out positions in the surrounding area.
You'd risk another ship finding her before you?
If necessary, yes. I may be competitive, but I won't see this trail lost because I'm too proud to ask for help. Fire is a monster and she must be run down.
Yeah. Well said. I'll relay the request.
So... how'd it go?
How'd what go?
Your dinner date.
Oh the food was great. Oxtail stew, Yorkshire pudding...
And your dining companion?
... *sigh* He wasn't interested in me at all. Oh, he was polite and we had nice conversation but what he really wanted was "better grub than wot the mess hall gets."

Fields.MenuText: That's too bad. At least the food was good?
That's a shame. You deserve someone who appreciates you.
Oh, thank God.

Fields.DialogueText: True. It was disappointing, but not a waste of an evening either.
You are a flatterer, Captain. But I appreciate the sentiment.
What?
Obviously, I'll have to make the next prize more about me. Maybe drinks instead of dinner...
*WOOF! WOOF!*
What's that, Cappy? We've got another fight on our hands?
So we do.
@BATTLE
Just a little cough.
Ah. So you can attract the sailors who miss booze rather than the ones who miss good food.
Heh.
Listen, Orion, I...
Captain! Another letter!
From your admirer?
It's been long enough I was starting to wonder if he'd given up.
Read it. Maybe there will be clues.
Let's see...
"I see your constellation rise in the sky, a giant astride the waves. At the prow you stand reflected, shining. Artemis, the moon, was rightly jealous of you."

Fields.MenuText: Quite the eloquent writer.
Laying it on a little thick there.
So he knows astronomy. Not a lot to suggest he's ever actually had a conversation with you, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Indeed. But there's more...
Nothing wrong with a little thick... eheh. Moving on.
"In your light I am but a small shadow. You may cast your eyes about the field only to lose me in the tall grass."
"I know only one power that will keep your gaze fixed. The lure of the hunt, the adventure of the unknown. Now I know you are looking. Will you track me down?"
Signed "The Hare."
I always thought the constellation Orion was chasing Taurus, not the Hare.
Well, the Hare is the one who's daring me to run him down, Captain. Priorities!
*WOOF, WOOF!*
Hmm? Oh... yes. Thanks to Cappy, I'm getting a better feel for when Morganas are approaching... when I'm not distracted.
So... tally ho, as they say?
@BATTLE
Don't be jealous.
I think it's actually something of a clue. This doesn't sound like any of the bridge crew.
Hm. Well, moving on...
So, explain this game they're setting up. "Aunt Sally" is an interesting name.
Well, I knew I wanted some sort of throwing contest for the skill portion of the tournament, but I also knew I wanted something more substantial than darts.
I was hoping for something traditional, like javelin, or discus, or archery.
I see problems with all of those on board a ship.
And more importantly, we don't have the equipment. When I asked around, I was mostly told "don't you know there's a war on?"
So I put the question to the men and, right away, one of them comes out with "Oh, you mean like Aunt Sally?"
All right, but what is it?
They play it in the pub gardens. Basically, you take wooden batons like this one here and you have to knock down a target with them.
The target varies depending on what's available. We're using this ball-on-a-stick as a sort of "doll". You mount it on a short pole, and that's called the "iron".
I thought it sounded rather tame till they told me the old versions supposedly used a chicken. The winner got to eat the bird after their throw killed it.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds... gruesome.
Sounds like good old time fun.
But why is it called "Aunt Sally"?

Fields.DialogueText: Sounds practical to me. Though, admittedly, not much fun for the chicken.
A good time and a good meal afterward. I see the appeal.
Some of the other origin legends involved a doll shaped like an old woman and... let's just say it's rather crude.
Oh, dear. I'm afraid we're going to have to stow all this for a bit.
Why?
Because in a moment, Cappy is going to start barking and I'm going to have to sound the alarm and we're going to have a fight on our hands.
@BATTLE
Two waves of Morganas in a row. That's hardly fair.
I wish I didn't have to ask the men to pack things up again, but...
The best thing to do at this point is reschedule. Hopefully, after this, we'll have a bit of a break.
@BATTLE
*APPLAUSE*
A solid doll! All right, Harley, you're up.
Oi, the little rabbit wants a go at the stake, eh? Hahaha!
*LAUGHTER*
Mmrrrph!
*DING*
Ooh, hit the iron. No good.
You know, I'm glad they're enjoying the competition, but I still think all this is rather tame.

Fields.MenuText: This whole thing could have been improved with some archery gear.
It's a good pace for me. I just wish I had a drink to go with it.
What you really mean is no one is playing with their shirt off.

Fields.DialogueText: I know! Bloody war on... it's not like anyone is shooting tanks with bows and arrows.
You are the captain. You could order a round for the house if you wanted.
It would help! The light down here is crap for photos too.
*ALARM*
One could wish the weather were better. Visibility's miserable.
Oh, don't be such a stick in the mud.
You just like not having to worry about bombers.
I never *worry* about them.
But, yes, it's nice knowing they're off being useless on some Morgana deck.
@BATTLE
All hands, stand down. Damage control crews, report to your commanders.
All right, Captain, go ahead.
Huh?
You've been itching to ask about my date with the last winner.
I didn't say that.
You've looked it.
Well, when Petty Officer Blethen won the game, you looked rather disappointed.
Don't get me wrong - I like Blethen. He's a regular at our darts games, he talks a good yarn, he's even got some hunting stories to tell.
I know him well... and that's the problem. I know he didn't write the letters. His mates put him up to writing one as a joke once. It was pretty awful.
The man can't spell to save his life.
And your mystery writer writes correctly and elegantly.
So what did you do?
Blethen asked if he could bring a few friends for the drinks. I said yes. We had a good time but not the one I was hoping for.
We did trade theories over who wrote the letters, but I'm afraid I'm no closer to an answer than before. And there's only one contest left.

Fields.MenuText: You're still going through with it?
Can you convince people like Blethen to sit it out?
Maybe you're running the wrong sort of contests.

Fields.DialogueText: People are looking forward to it. It's still worth it for the entertainment.
I could slip a hint to the regulars. Some of them would be miffed, though.
I'm trying to find people who understand me. Doesn't it make sense that the contests would concern things I enjoy?
In any case, the race should go on. But I'm afraid the trail is going cold.
... Hey. Do you mind if I ask you a serious question?
Not at all.
How much does this mean to you? Really, I mean. I've assumed it was just a lark, but if you're serious about this guy...
Oh, it's a lark.
Mostly.
But it's flattering. It's nice to feel wanted. You know?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah. That's fair.
You dummy.
Dammit. If I ask you out now, it'll just sound like I'm taking pity on you.

Fields.DialogueText: Pardon?
Damn. Hoist with my own petard!
You seriously think some anonymous pen pal is the only one on this ship who wants you? Good grief, woman.
Ha!
Hey, you feel like standing around for a while and watching storm clouds with me?
I'd be delighted, Captain.
*BOOM*
Huzzah! Go! Go!
Erk. Damn this high swell.
Surely you're not getting seasick, Captain.
No, I'm worried. With sea spray on a pitching deck, the last thing I want is to have to stop the race for a man overboard.
The risk just makes the experience more exciting!

Fields.MenuText: Speak for yourself. A fall to the water from deck height is no joke.
I mean, it does, but you'll be upset if we have to stop.
Actually, I am feeling a bit green...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, I know, Captain. But fear stopping you from having fun is no way to live.
Okay, you have a point there.
I've got some tea with ginger if you want me to send for some.
And number three, Seaman Harley Abney, is first across the line with a burst of speed in this qualifying heat!
Oh, Harley's in the running.
You know him? Who's he?
National Service recruit. I ran into him once. He was sneaking Cappy some bacon.
That's sweet of him.
*WOOF! WOOF!*
Speaking of... hmm? Oh no, not now!
Bloody hell. Lieutenant, stop the next contest! Orion, hit the alarm!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Status report?
We've got some time before we arrive at port for our resupply.
We can finish the races if we get things cleaned up quickly.

Fields.MenuText: I shouldn't be surprised that's your first thought.
Right, let's snap to it, then.
After that fight, are you sure they're going to be up for it?

Fields.DialogueText: No time like the present! Let's go!
Quick march! On the double! Runners to your places! And tosh like that.
Think of it as an unplanned endurance test! ... No?
*SOME TIME LATER*
Coming around the turn on the stern end, we have Harley Abney, the lanky lad of Derbyshire, fighting for first with Doug McQuerry, the Scottish speedster!
What a fine picture this will make!
Look at that McQuerry! The fellow has got legs on him!
I can't believe he decided to do the run in a kilt.
Can you blame him for wanting to show off?
And Neal Ogden of Belfast makes his move in the straightaway! He's gaining on McQuerry while Abney's pace looks to be flagging...
Stapleton is also pushing for a comeback! But it doesn't look like it will be enough as the pack pushes for the finish...
And it's McQueeeeerry taking first place! Ogden makes up enough ground for second and just edges Abney out for third!
Huff... huff... bloody hell...
Well done, all of you! Come over, let me get a picture...
She's paying all the attention to McQuerry, but there's something about the way Harley's looking at her...
@BATTLE
So, no, I don't think McQuerry wrote the letters - not least because he can't stop talking about his girl back in Inverness.
*AROO? WOOF!*
Cappy? Where are you--
Hey there, boy, I -- Oh!
Oh, hullo.
H-h-hi.
Your name is Harley, right? The Captain told me you've been making friends with Cappy.
Oh. Yeah. I... I'm a bit afraid of dogs, actually. But they're nice when they're puppies. I thought it would help, getting to know him.
He is a good boy - aren't you, Cappy?
*WOOF!*
Heh... heh.
... Poor guy. He looks like a deer in headlights.
*WOOF! WOOF WOOF!*
Oh, no... he's doing that thing again...
Yeah. There's the Morgana bark.
@BATTLE
That doesn't sound like the Morgana bark.
No, I don't think it is.
On your date? Ouch.
It wasn't a date date. So don't look so smug.
Uh-huh.
I have to say, though, did you see the man's legs? Hercules himself would be--
There you are. I don't usually find you here on the bow deck unless we're chasing Morganas.
Mm.
Is that another letter?
It is. Sorry, Captain, I'm in a bit of a mood.
Anything new?
It's poetry.
That is new.
"I ran by - a flash in the grassy sea, daring the hunter to take up her bow. But I turn around and there is only me. I wonder if it will be always so."
"Can I ever be your most worthy foe? Is your light too bright for my shadow to match? The shy hare darts off, afraid of your eyes, The blind hunter tries, keeps missing the catch."
Ouch. "The blind hunter?"
Yes, well. I haven't exactly spotted him, have I? Or her. Whatever.
Well. I think my romantic life is... ha. I don't think this person is who I want. But I would hate to leave the mystery unsolved, even if nothing else comes of it.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure it's not impossible to solve. There's only, oh, 500 sailors aboard?
Understood. I do think we should probably talk about who you *do* want sometime, though.
I can understand. You'd regret not knowing.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, objectively - no, it's not.
Oh, we will. But let's get this business out of the way first.
You're right. Every hunter has a story about the one that got away.
I guess I'm open to suggestions at this point.
Hmm, well... oh, is that a mist on the horizon?
Damn. Yes, it is.
*sigh* I don't think my heart's in the Morgana hunt right now, but duty calls.
@BATTLE
Hey. It's not your fault if his - or her - fantasy isn't playing out according to plan.
Did I say it was? My fault, I mean.
Point taken. But it doesn't sound like either you or Secret Shakespeare are having a lot of fun anymore.
There's some bitterness in that poem, isn't there?
Or unfortunate word choice. That can happen when you write poetry in the small hours of the morning.
Even so. I think you're right, though. I think he's about done with the game.
Sorry. I guess.
*WOOF WOOF!*
Hey there, boy. Sorry, I've got to do paperwork before I can play.
*AROO?*
You're giving me that look. *sigh* Hard to resist that.
Maybe I should have a word with that Harley fellow about dog sitting.
... You know, maybe it's not a coincidence that he keeps showing up. I wonder...
*ALARM*
Oh dammit. Cappy, you stay here!
*WOOF!  WOOF WOOF!*
@BATTLE
That'll chase ‘em off for a good while.
Orion? Do you have a minute?
Captain, for you I have at least three or four. What's on your mind?
Like you said, they were fun. They were a boon to crew morale, they gave you a chance to gawp at muscular men in kilts...
Point taken. So you're suggesting... ?
A poetry contest.
Poetry? Would people even be interested in that?
But, that said, you could make it a more generalized talent show and list poetry as an option.
Hm. I suppose it's worth a try. But will you help me? I don't know much about organizing a talent show.
A few things. First... well, earlier today I was thinking about another possible candidate for Secret Shakespeare. And that led me to think about the way the contests have been working.
What? They've been fun.
And who's your candidate?
You don't really want me to tell you, do you? If I guess right, then you don't have the satisfaction - and if I'm wrong, it's just a waste of time.
Fine. Table that for now. What about the contests?
I did like that part.
But they didn't really play to your admirer's demonstrated interests. Even if he wanted to compete, there's no particular reason to assume that he'd stand out.
And that's fine! But if your primary goal is to find out who this guy is...
Again, there's crew morale, and there's bringing out your target. They're separate goals.

Fields.MenuText: Sure. It's as simple as anything, really...
Oh, sure. But you should know I plan to flirt extravagantly with you the whole time.
Lies. You're just looking for somebody to do all the tedious parts.

Fields.DialogueText: True. In fairness, you're nice to look at, too.
Well, I just like this idea more and more!
I'm listening...
Captain, that light in the distance! Something's burning!
That port has a supply depot. Maybe an air raid?
Nothing from the radio room yet. But I don't think so. It's hard to tell at this range, but my gut says Morganas. Fire may be making her move.
If we move on this, we risk a stormy battle. Are you sure?
I will risk it! Confirm with Command if you have to, but do it quickly and let's get going!

Fields.MenuText: Change course now. We'll get on the radio while we move.
I'll radio Command right now. I'll do my best to convince them its urgent.
Just go. If Command has a problem, they can complain after we've dealt with the emergency.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm on it!
Hurry, Captain! Every moment is precious!
Hah! Glad you're starting to see things my way!
*SOME TIME LATER*
Still no contact from port. Whatever happened, their communications must be out.
The scout pilot says no sign of Fire. But this is definitely her work. One minute and we'll be able to see...
... Oh gods. Even the ships in dock are an inferno. This is the worst yet!
Focus, Orion! Any other Morganas?
Sorry, yes! They're picking at the wreckage like vultures.
Get away, you filthy scavengers!
@BATTLE
When the lady called Godiva rode upon a white horse grand, I was standin' at the corner with me daisies in me 'and...
There you are, Captain.
Sorry, I've been tied up in reports. How's the show going?
A good laugh for the most part. No sign of our hare yet, though.

Fields.MenuText: It's early yet. If this doesn't bring him out, I don't think anything will.
Well, at least you're enjoying yourself.
With our luck, we'll be interrupted by a Morgana attack.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope it works.
For the moment, yes.
Hisss. Don't jinx it!
I guess as long as everybody's having a good time, it's a good thing.
You're not holding out hope?
I don't know. I didn't offer a date as a prize this time - the main prize will be by audience vote.
I left the option of offering a special "Belle's Prize," but I won't say what it is.
That's smart, actually. He can't slip up at the finish line that way.
Hmm?
Oh, nothing...
... oh. Damn. Damn damn damn!
You think of something?
No. Morganas.
Damn!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
DAMN DAMN DAMN DAMN!
That can be our new ship's motto, if you like.
Don't make me laugh just before a battle.
@BATTLE
I should be used to the Morganas interrupting everything by now, but I'm not! I'm really not!
All right, take a deep breath.
... *sigh* Okay. I can be calm. But, dammit, it's near impossible to plan nice things around here.
We can resume the show after the cleanup here.
*SOME TIME LATER*
We've got enough of a crowd, but a lot of people have dropped out, including a couple of the acts.
People are tired - and, honestly, so am I.

Fields.MenuText: It will help them unwind, if nothing else.
I'm still hopeful it will work. Try to stick it out.
Would it help if I ordered drinks for the room?

Fields.DialogueText: A fair point. I'll try to enjoy that, at least.
I really hope you're right.
Hah. If you mean something stronger than tea, I'm game.
*APPLAUSE*
Oh, it's Cappy's friend...
H-h-h-ello. *ulp* I'd like to recite a poem.
... *phew* Ahem. I--
... I ran by - a flash in the grassy sea, daring the hunter to take up her bow...
Oh, gods... !
Good for him. I hope you're not too impressed, I should add, but...
And yet the hare dares in tempting the hound, leaving a scent trail where e'er he's run. For by your beauty the hare is bound, though the hunter could do with anyone.
The hare leaps through fire and does not burn, though my heart's fire may yet forever yearn.
*APPLAUSE*
...  Well. That couldn't be clearer if there were a thunderbolt from heaven to confirm it.
Be nice.
Hell. Now what am I going to do?
I could throw him off the ship.
Don't make me laugh in front of the crew.
Captain, we've got a radio callout. A transport a few hours out of port sighted a Morgana wolfpack. Also, one of the ships matched the description of our augmented Fire.
Damn. How far out?
Bit over an hour, at least.
Relay the new heading to the helm and put the crew on standby.
Aye, Captain.
*AROO?*
It sounds like I'm going to have to intrude on Orion and Harley's tea party, Cappy.
And this is not an excuse to spy on them and see how the "letting him down easy" is going...
*WOOF!*
Okay, not just an excuse.
So how come I've never seen you down in the mess with the others?
Well... we were never rich, but the quarry work paid well enough that Da could send me to the boys school.
The classes were all right but the other kids... I think I almost rather wished we were poor. N-not that they cared about the difference.
Ah. That explains things. Schoolboys and sailors can be rather a rough lot.
I-I've gotta put up with it though, you know? I don't think I'd have signed up if I had a choice, but I know how important this is.
We're an island nation. Between the Morganas at sea and Hitler eying us over the Channel... if you can't run, you gotta fight, you know?
I admit I don't think much about running... except toward things.
You're so fearless... I don't know how I could ever be like that.
Hell. It's going to be like kicking a puppy.
*KNOCK*
Orion, sorry. Something's come up...
Bloody hell. Harley, I'm sorry. This always happens.
N-n-no, it's okay. I understand.
@BATTLE
That's the third false trail in a row... or the third time Fire has slipped us before we could catch her.
We're gaining on her, surely.
Yes. And from the attack reports, she's daring to come further away from the heart of the mists. But we're going to have to trap her.
Command has called some of the other hunters to help cut off the escape routes. We're already doing all we can.
I know.
So... let's talk about something else. How's Harley?
Hmm...
Hmm... ?
It's not really my place to tell you what he told me about himself, I think.
Harley... is a nice lad. I feel bad for him - he's had it rough. And I know it was hard for him to reach out to me the way he did.
But... now I feel responsible for him and I don't know what to do about it. He said I make him "braver than he's ever been."
So, how do I get him to keep feeling that way without giving him the idea that I'll be turning up in his bunk someday?

Fields.MenuText: Listen, he's going to be fine.
If you want, I could throw you down and ravish you on a mess hall table.
Seriously, it's not your problem. You didn't ask him to be infatuated with you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's... thank you, Captain.
... Just give me a second to process that image, okay?
I know, I know.
I don't know what I'll do. I hope we can still be friends.
Captain, I have to ask. You and I are becoming... something, right?
You are definitely not to me what Harley is to you. In fact, if you...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
No. Certainly not. I mean, unless he's plotting mutiny.
No worries on that front.
Captain?
Just give me a second to process that image, okay?
Heh.
Whatever you say to him, he's talked to the girl he likes, he's read poetry in front of a room full of half-drunk sailors, he's taken part in physical competitions I bet he never imagined before.
He knows he did all that. When he meets the person who really is right for him, he'll be ready. Readier, anyway.
You don't owe him anything more than that. That's plenty.
Ha! Touché.
Word that you're unavailable would probably get around pretty quickly.
I'm pretty sure he'll agree to that. For Cappy's sake, if nothing else.
Heh.
If not... I mean, if I'm to you what Harley is to me, I'd like you to tell me so I can take the embarrassment out on the Morganas.
I HATE THESE THINGS SO MUCH!
Target confirmed! It's her for sure!
Two Belle-led groups have confirmed they are engaged with the diversionary packs. The other has fanned out to cut off Fire's escape.
All stations report ready. Orion? Go get her.
Aye! She's mine!
@BATTLE
Hssssssssssss!
She's limping back into the mists. It will be a while before she goes after the ports again.
Incoming fire!
A parting shot?
It's a wide volley! Orion, can you evade?
Trying!
*BOOM*
Incendiary shell! Hit on the stern deck!
Ow, ow, damn her, damn her!
Suppression crews! Hurry! Orion, damage report!
I'm fine at the moment, but there were crew in the blast zone. Ogden is going to cook in the rear turret if someone doesn't get him out and... oh!
Orion, where are you--!
Cappy is down there!
*WOOF! WOOF! AROOOOO!*
*cough* Cappy? I got you...  Ow! Oh God...  *cough cough* I can't see...
Cappy!? Cappy?!
Orion! I've got him! But we're trap--
Oh God, Oh God, gotta run, gotta run...
Auuugh!
Aaah! Harley!
*WHIMPER*
What happened?!
Harley must have come after Cappy, and to escape the fire, he jumped through... oh gods. Medic!
*ALARM*
Almost in range, Captain.
Very good.
@BATTLE
Whew. And that's it for the diversionary packs.
Captain, as soon as we're clear, I'm going down to the infirmary.
Of course. I'll come too, if that's all right.
Those incendiaries are horrible stuff, nothing like I've seen. Anyone near the heart of the blast that survived... they'll be wishing they hadn't.
And Harley?
Better than those. But he caught that secondary flare-up to his back and his feet and arms are badly singed.
He'll recover with care, but it's going to be long and painful. I'll have to request a discharge for him.
Can I talk to him?
He's in a bit of a morphine haze, but he should be awake.
H-h-hey.

Fields.MenuText: Well... I guess the hare can get burned.
Well, I have some good news. They plan to send you home.
I won't keep you long. Just, for the record, you're a damn hero in my book.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. Heh heh. ... Ow.
That's... good.
T-th-thanks.
Orion... I heard...
Ssh. Harley...
You are more than just a frightened hare. I may be fearless, but you, Captain, are brave. You really don't need me for that. You never did.
I don't... feel brave.
You got through all you did and kept going. That's all bravery really is.
And you're going to need more yet, to get through this. I won't be with you, but I promise I'll do what I can.
... Thank you.
We should let him rest.
I'll stay until he falls asleep.
Good. Let me know if you need anything.
*ALARM*
The good news is that this should be the end of Fire's little expeditionary force.
Reports have Morgana activities way down throughout the region.
No offense, Captain, but... we can congratulate ourselves when it's done.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
We should be clear from here to port now.
Captain, join me for tea afterward? I've still got some of that Darjeeling left.
Of course.
*SOME TIME LATER*
So Harley's leave has been approved. He'll be transferred to a medical transport in port.
Will you two keep in touch?
He promised to write. And so did I, though I'm not as good at it as him.
I'm glad.
We need to find a way to let the nurses know he got hurt rescuing a puppy from a Morgana attack - that'll get him some well-deserved attention.
Oh, I'll make sure it's on his paperwork.
So. Are you okay?
I'm always okay. Are you okay?
Generally speaking. And, listen, for what it's worth, I think you've handled yourself with extraordinary grace over the last few days.
I know.
Heh.
Thank *you* for not throwing Harley over the side of the ship when we first found him out. I know the jealousy must have been fearsome.
It kind of was, actually.
Good.
Ha! I think I'm going to have to kiss you just to keep you from smirking.
I mean, if you actually think it'll work....
